maml:description.maml:para: Adds numbers to the items from the pipeline.
Adds numbers to the items from the pipeline. The `StartingIndex` parameter specifies the starting number. The `Step` parameter specifies the number to add each iteration.
The input from the pipeline.
The starting index.
the value that will be added to the current index each iteration.
The input from the pipeline.
The starting index.
the value that will be added to the current index each iteration.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> "A".."Z" | Add-Index -StartingIndex 1
Index Item ----- ---- 1 A 2 B 3 C 4 D 5 E 6 F 7 G 8 H 9 I 10 J 11 K 12 L 13 M 14 N 15 O 16 P 17 Q 18 R 19 S 20 T 21 U 22 V 23 W 24 X 25 Y 26 Z

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a collection of items to the end of the current pipeline.
Adds a collection of items to the end of the current pipeline.
A collection of objects to chain at the end of this pipe.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
A collection of objects to chain at the end of this pipe.
Zips items from the pipe with the items in a collection.
Zips items from the pipe with the items in a collection.
A collection to join with the current pipe.
{{ Fill Input Description }}
{{ Fill Input Description }}
A collection to join with the current pipe.
Skips items from the pipeline.
Skips items from the pipeline.
How many items to skip.
The input from the pipeline.
Skip last N items instead.
Skip items while this script block evaluates to true.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
Skip last N items instead.
How many items to skip.
Skip items while this script block evaluates to true.
Alternates between the pipe and a collection.

Alternates between the current pipe and a provided collection. By default, items will be taken from each side 1 by 1. First item taken is always from the pipe. The `-Left` and `-Right` parameters specify how many items to take from the respective sources in each alternation. If the `-DiscardRest` flag is set, no value will be produced after an alternation produces incomplete values (e.g a source runs out of items/ it doesn't have enough items to produce).
A collection to alternate with.
Any object from the pipeline.
Discard leftover items if left or right are drained before the other.
How many items to take from the left pipe in each alternation.
How many items to take from the right collection in each alternation.
Discard leftover items if left or right are drained before the other.
Any object from the pipeline.
How many items to take from the left pipe in each alternation.
How many items to take from the right collection in each alternation.
A collection to alternate with.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $left = "left 1", "left 2", "left 3" PS C:\> $right = "right 1", "right2", "right3", "right4", "right5" PS C:\> $left | Switch-Pipe $right -Right 2 -DiscardRest
left 1 right 1 right2 left 2 right3 right4

maml:description.maml:para: Takes items from the pipeline.
Takes items from the pipeline, ignoring the rest.
How many items to take.
The input from the pipeline.
Take last N items instead.
Take items while this script block evaluates to true.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
Take last N items instead.
How many items to take.
Take items while this script block evaluates to true.
Asserts that every item from the pipeline fits within a criteria.
Asserts that every item from the pipeline fits within a criteria.
The criteria can be a script block returning true/false or a value that will be checked for equality.
A predicate that evaluates to a bool.
The input from the pipeline.
Test that all values from the pipeline are equal to this one.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
A predicate that evaluates to a bool.
Test that all values from the pipeline are equal to this one.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $text = "banana is good >> banana is life >> my brother was beaten badly with a banana wielding man" >> PS C:\> $text.split("`n") | Test-All { $_.contains("banana") }
True

maml:description.maml:para: Tests if any item from the pipeline fits within the criteria given.

Checks if any item from the pipeline satisfies the given criteria. The criteria can be a script block returning true/false or a value that will be checked for equality. The script block won't be executed after it returns true.
A predicate that evaluates to a bool.
The input from the pipeline.
Test that any value from the pipeline is equal to this one.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
A predicate that evaluates to a bool.
Test that any value from the pipeline is equal to this one.
Tests if no item in the pipeline satisfies the criteria given.

Tests if no item in the pipeline satisfies the criteria given. The criteria can be a script block returning true/false or a value that will be checked for equality. The script block will not be executed after it returns false.
A predicate that evaluates to a bool.
The input from the pipeline.
Test that no value from the pipeline is equal to this one.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
A predicate that evaluates to a bool.
Test that no value from the pipeline is equal to this one.
